SITUATION REPORT
There are rapidly developing moves to establish a new PTV
station organization governed exclusively by a lay board
of chairmen of licensees who could speak to CPB "with a
unified voice." By-Laws for a reconstituted PBS will be
prepared for a March 28, Washington meeting of managers
and board representatives with the intent that the new
entity be voted into being at that time.
Let me recall the sequence of recent events that have shaped
the present situation.
January 10/ 1973; CPB Board asserts its authority over __
program funding and distribution.
January 12, 1973: Governing Board Coordinating Committee,
headed by Ralph Rogers, asserts that such an arrangement is
unacceptable to TV licensees, demands partnership in these
two areas and asks for meeting with CPB Board.
January 23-26, 1973; ETS and PBS Boards endorse resolution
of Rogers' group, authorize his group to negotiate on their'
behalf regarding those two points.
February 7, 1973: Committee from Governing Board Group meets
with CPB Board, succeeds in achieving compromise agreement on
national program funding decisions and. free access to interÂ¬
connection - providing CPB can henceforth deal with a single
entity authorized to speak for the licensees.
February 13-16, 1973: Palm Beach is site of meeting of ETS,
PBS, NAEB, and representatives of Governing Boards. Group
agrees to concept of a single voice to be expressed through
a lay board, works on a set of principles for a new entity
of some sort.
February 23, 1973: Representatives of NAEB meet with Rogers
to discuss possible merger or amalgamation with new PTV entity
February 27, 1973: ETS Board meets, approve principles of
"Palm Beach Accord" with reservations, particularly with
respect to impact on NAEB.
February 28, 1973: Harley has exploratory session with
Friendly on possibility of Ford support for NAEB in case new
entity established.
